intro: Rondeletia microphylla var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved rondeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value is due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
